Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for data storage, including capacity, scalability, and performance needs. Identify the types of data to be stored and access patterns.
Design the storage architecture, including folder structure, naming conventions, and integration with other Azure services. Plan for data lifecycle management and retention policies.

Tasks.Task: Create Azure Data Lake Storage Account
Tasks.Task Description: Provision a new Azure Data Lake Storage account in the Azure portal. Choose the appropriate performance tier and redundancy options.
Set up role-based access control (RBAC) and Azure Active Directory (AAD) integration to manage permissions for users and applications.
Ensure data is encrypted at rest and in transit using Azure Storage encryption features. Configure customer-managed keys if required.
Configure virtual network (VNet) integration, private endpoints, and firewall rules to secure access to the storage account.
Set up pipelines for ingesting data into Azure Data Lake Storage using Azure Data Factory or other tools. Ensure data is validated and transformed as needed.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and Storage Analytics to track storage usage, performance, and security events.
Perform testing to ensure the storage account is configured correctly. Validate access controls, encryption, and data ingestion pipelines.
Create detailed documentation of the storage account setup, including architecture, access controls, and operational procedures.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting Azure Data Lake Storage.
Define and implement data governance policies, including data classification, access reviews, and compliance monitoring.
Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with security and governance policies. Review access logs and storage usage reports.
Continuously monitor the storage utilization of Azure Data Lake Storage to ensure it remains within allocated limits and identify any unusual spikes in usage.
Conduct periodic checks to verify the integrity of data stored in Azure Data Lake Storage and ensure there is no corruption or loss.
Perform audits of the storage configuration to ensure compliance with organizational policies and best practices.
Implement and maintain a backup strategy for critical data stored in Azure Data Lake Storage to ensure data recovery in case of accidental deletion or corruption.
Analyze storage performance metrics and optimize configurations to ensure efficient data access and processing.
Regularly rotate encryption keys used for securing data in Azure Data Lake Storage to enhance security and comply with organizational policies.
Conduct tests of the disaster recovery plan to ensure that data can be restored quickly and effectively in case of a major incident.
Perform regular security audits to identify vulnerabilities and ensure compliance with security standards.
Review storage costs and usage patterns to identify opportunities for cost optimization and ensure budget adherence.
Ensure that data lifecycle policies are correctly implemented and align with organizational data retention requirements.
Conduct drills to prepare the team for responding to potential security incidents or data breaches.
Evaluate the performance of Azure Data Lake Storage against SLAs and address any deviations.
